title: BBC Local Live: Beds, Herts & Bucks on Thursday, 31 December 2015. - BBC News
summary: more than 40 people across beds , herts and bucks are recognised in the new year honours .
an inquest is due to be opened today into the deaths of two people in a caravan fire in bedfordshire .
more news , sport , travel and weather updates from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for beds , herts and bucks have finished for the day , but we 'll be back from 08:00 on monday with the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
have a great new year 's eve !

documents.title: knickers model 's own : fundraising efforts recognised by prime minister
text: the efforts of harpenden woman caroline jones in wearing charity clothes for a year to raise money for cancer research uk have been recognised by prime minister david cameron , who awarded her a point of light award , an accolade to celebrate people 's `` remarkable achievements '' .
mr cameron said : `` caroline has come up with an innovative way to pay tribute to her mother and raise a fantastic amount of money for charity .

`` as well as raising money for an important cause , caroline has helped raise awareness of the benefits of shopping in charity shops and that , with a little styling outfits , can be ethical and fashionable . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: women who 've served their communities for years honoured
text: three women who 've all given years of service to their local communities have been rewarded in the new year honours .

helen fowler , 91 , who 's a volunteer reading assistant at two primary schools in amersham has been awarded the british empire medal for more than 40 years work instilling a love of reading in children .
others to receive the bem are mary cutler , 77 , from st albans for her work with the grove house hos and marjorie cotton , 71 , for service to the community in cranfield , bedfordshire .
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: local people honoured for sporting achievements
text: more news now of the people across beds , herts and bucks who have been recognised in the new year honours .

those honoured for their sporting achievements include motor racing legend paddy hopkirk who became famous in the 1960s when he won the monte carlo rally in a mini cooper - he is appointed mbe for services to motoring and young people .
an mbe also goes to tracey neville ( sister of footballer brothers gary and phillip - for services to netball .
the former international is head coach of the hitchin-based england netball .
author: Ollie Bayliss
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: ex-luton boss still back in management at daggers
text: sacked luton town boss john still has n't taken long to get back into management .
the 65-year-old , who led the hatters back into the football league , was fired earlier this month after four straight league two defeats .
but he has today been announced as the new manager at relegation-threatened dagenham , who he left to join luton in february 2013 .
it is his third spell at the daggers .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: prisoner found dead at hmp woodhill
text: a prisoner has been found dead in his cell at hmp woodhill in milton keynes .
the man , who was found unresponsive in his cell on tuesday morning , is believed to be the 10th person to die at the prison since 2013 .
`` staff and paramedics attempted resuscitation but he was pronounced dead shortly after 06:00 , '' the prison office said .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: roxton boatyard fire : inquests opened and adjourned
text: inquests have been opened into the deaths of a man and a woman in a caravan fire at roxton in bedfordshire .
daniel breen , 77 , and elsie walker , 69 , both from hatfield , were killed in the blaze at the kelpie marina boatyard off the great north road at about 01:00 on 18 december .
bedfordshire 's senior coroner tom osborne adjourned the inquests at ampthill coroners ' court today for full hearings in april .
the cause of the fire is being investigated .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bedfordshire gritters will be on the road tonight
text: as weather forecasters predict a much colder night than we 've been used to , central beds council say they will be gritting the roads tonight .
full gritting tonight !
our winter maintenance team will be out tonight salting the road network .
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid look forward to seeing them in eaton bray
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: faruk ali case : misconduct hearing against officers to go ahead as pccs recruit panel chairs
text: a long awaited misconduct hearing against two beds police officers can now go ahead in the new year , the herald & post has confirmed .
author: Luton News

documents.title: weather update : showers clearing later
text: this afternoon will start sunny , but will turn cloudy with showery rain and top temperatures of about 10c ( 50f ) .
the showers are due to clear away this evening , leaving long clear spells overnight .
temperatures will fall to about 1c ( 33f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: bedford man dies in staples corner collision
text: a man who died on a slip-road of the m1 just before christmas was a demolition worker from bedford whose van had broken down on the motorway , the metropolitan police said .
patrick downer , 55 , who had been travelling in a van with four other men , was trying to find public transport when he was hit by a van at staples corner in north london .
the driver was arrested on sus of driving under the influence of drugs and causing death by careless driving .
author: Lee Agnew
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: roxton boatyard fire : inquest due to open
text: an inquest is due to open today at ampthill coroner 's court into the deaths of two people in a caravan fire in bedfordshire .
fire broke out at the kelpie marine boat yard on the a1 at roxton , in the early hours of 18 december .
daniel breen , 77 , and elsie walker , 69 , both from hatfield , died from smoke inhalation .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lunchtime headlines : prisoner found dead at woodhill new year 's honours
text: here are the top stories we 've been looking at today :
author: Lee Agnew
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: chief fire officer 'delighted ' with new year honour
text: bedfordshire fire and rescue 's chief fire officer paul fuller says he is `` hugely delighted and honoured '' to become a cbe in the new year honours .
mr fuller joined the fire service in 1978 and became chief fire officer for bedfordshire in february 2002 after a career with west midlands , west sussex , staffordshire and wiltshire fire services .

he said : `` although a great personal honour , this is also a well-deserved tribute to everyone in bedfordshire fire and rescue service , the chief fire officers association and partners throughout the fire sector for the marvellous work they do to save and protect people 's lives . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: campaign continues to keep st albans attraction open
text: a former watford mayor is urging the owners of butterfly world near st albans to reverse plans to close it to give campaigners a chance to set up a charity and take over .
the centre in chiswell green was opened six years ago by sir david attenborough , but owners breheny say they wo n't reopen next after the winter break .
more than 36,000 people have signed a petition against its closure .

john horsfield said : `` i 'd like a six month breathing period so we can get this charity up and running , then i think if we could talk to them , we could work out a strategy which does n't involve a huge buying price . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: karl robinson : dons ready for transfer window
text: milton keynes dons manager karl robinson says they 're ready for the opening of the january transfer window , with plans to boost the squad in the battle against relegation from the championship .
he said : `` we want to bring players in , we want to bring in four , i know three of them .
`` it 's our job now internally to try to find the right ones that suit this football club and we 'll have do that in the best possible way . ''
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: knickers model 's own : year of charity clothes goes 'out with a bang '
text: a woman wearing charity shop outfits for a year to raise money for cancer research says she is `` fusing fashion and science '' in her final outfit because `` without science you ca n't have the cancer research shops '' .
caroline jones , 47 , from harpenden in hertfordshire , began knickers model 's own in memory of her mother mary benson , who died of breast cancer .
her 365th outfit is a modified lab coat from cancer research uk scientists at the cambridge institute .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: firefighters remove aerial after 'concerns it could fall '
text: buckinghamshire fire service removed a three metre ( 9.8ft ) aerial mast and loose brickwork from a four-storey building in milton keynes last night , following concerns they could fall .
firefighters were called to rowditch furlong , redhouse park just after 23:15 .
picture from last night 's aerial mast and loose brickwork removal in # miltonkeynes
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: five treated after aylesbury wheat bag fire
text: five people have been treated for smoke inhalation after a fire in aylesbury last night .
a wheat bag caught fire in a microwave oven in prebendal close just after 22:00 .
firefighters gave oxygen to one woman , and three other women and a man were treated by paramedics .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: honour for retired st albans judge 's reform work
text: a retired judge , recognised in the new year honours for his work to reform drug addicts , has said he is `` absolutely delighted '' .
his honour michael findlay baker qc , of ware , hertfordshire , has become a cbe for his services to the administration of justice .
judge baker , 72 , promoted a programme which aims to break the cycle of offending by drug addicts while resident judge at st albans crown court .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: morning headlines : local people recognised in new year honours
text: here are the stories we 're looking at this morning :
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: today 's weather : sunny spells and heavy showers
text: there will be some sunny spells this morning , before a band of heavy rain moves across the region .
it is due to be a clear evening with temperatures down to freezing .
maximum temperature : 10c ( 50f ) .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: computer says 'no ' : sorry , we 've had a few technical problems
text: we 've had a few technical problems this morning on local live and the wider bbc website - we know , it 's been frustrating .
fortunately , rumours of the apocalypse have been greatly exaggerated .
our apologies for the inconvenience .

documents.title: aylesbury fire family thank community for aid
text: a family in aylesbury say the local community has rallied round to help them after a fire earlier this month forced them out of their home .
a couple and their 14-year-old daughter managed to escape from their friarscroft way home after fire broke out in the lounge , but their pet dog died .

gemma shaw said : `` everyone 's come out of every little crevice to help with presents , food , furniture , clothing it 's never ending and it 's still coming , we are so , so grateful and very thankful to everybody . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: local people recognised in new year honours
text: more than 40 people across beds , herts and bucks have received honours this year including the chief executive of luton-based airline easyjet .
carolyn mccall has been made a dame while a former resident judge at st albans crown court , michael findlay baker qc and bedfordshire 's chief fire officer paul fuller have been appointed cbe .
among those appointed obe are the president of the aa , edmund king , from st albans and detective sergeant andrew watson from thames valley police for services to policing and counter terrorism .
author: Carol Abercrombie
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: latest headlines : local people recognised in new year honours aylesbury fire family thank community
text: here are the stories we 're looking at this morning :
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: welcome to local live for beds , herts and bucks
text: good morning and welcome to the end of the year on our live page where we 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for the three counties .
if you 'd like to get in touch , you can send us an email or tweet .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live
